Biosim

API Reference¶

Module simulation¶

biosim.simulation defines the BioSim class interface for simulation of Rossumøya’s ecosystem.

Module island¶

biosim.island defines an island, populates the island and defines the annual cycle.

The user can define:
  • The island map.
class biosim.island.Island(island_map=None)[source]¶

This class generates the island Rossum island and its ecosystem behaviour.

Attributes:
population_in_each_cell

This method calculates the herbivore and carnivore population for each cell.

total_island_population

Finds the total number of animals on the island.

total_species_population

Finds the total number of herbivores and carnivores on the island, in the first and second element of the returned tuple, respectively.

Methods

annual_cycle() This method carries out one cycle on the island.
find_cell_position(cell) Finds the numpy map coordinates of the cell.
find_surrounding_cells(position) Collects a cell’s neighbouring landscape types.
landscape_position_in_map() Creates a numpy array map from the string map.
populate_the_island([start_population]) Populates the island with an input start population.
validate_map_string() Validates that a the input map string follows the constraints of the model.

This method creates variables needed for the class.

Attributes:
population_in_each_cell

This method calculates the herbivore and carnivore population for each cell.

total_island_population

Finds the total number of animals on the island.

total_species_population

Finds the total number of herbivores and carnivores on the island, in the first and second element of the returned tuple, respectively.

Methods

annual_cycle() This method carries out one cycle on the island.
find_cell_position(cell) Finds the numpy map coordinates of the cell.
find_surrounding_cells(position) Collects a cell’s neighbouring landscape types.
landscape_position_in_map() Creates a numpy array map from the string map.
populate_the_island([start_population]) Populates the island with an input start population.
validate_map_string() Validates that a the input map string follows the constraints of the model.
annual_cycle()[source]¶

This method carries out one cycle on the island.

Return total_species_population:
 tuple, first element is herbivore population and second element is carnivore population.
find_cell_position(cell)[source]¶

Finds the numpy map coordinates of the cell.

Parameters:cell – a landscape object in the numpy map.
Return position:
 tuple (cell coordinates).
find_surrounding_cells(position)[source]¶

Collects a cell’s neighbouring landscape types.

Parameters:position – tuple (cell coordinates).
Return neighbour_cells:
 list, objects of adjacent cells.
landscape_position_in_map()[source]¶

Creates a numpy array map from the string map.

populate_the_island(start_population=None)[source]¶

Populates the island with an input start population.

Parameters:start_population – list, lists of dictionaries with keys “loc” (location) and “pop” (population).
population_in_each_cell¶

This method calculates the herbivore and carnivore population for each cell.

Returns:numpy.ndarray, the herbivore and carnivore population in the first and second element of each list, respectively.
total_island_population¶

Finds the total number of animals on the island.

Returns:int
total_species_population¶

Finds the total number of herbivores and carnivores on the island, in the first and second element of the returned tuple, respectively.

Returns:tuple.
validate_map_string()[source]¶

Validates that a the input map string follows the constraints of the model.

Module landscape¶

biosim.landscape defines how a landscape object should behave and how its animal population interact with each other and their surroundings. The subclasses, Jungle, Savannah, Desert, Mountain and Ocean, contains information about the differences between each landscape type, e.g. availability and regeneration of fodder.

class biosim.landscape.Desert[source]¶

Defines the desert type.

Attributes:
available_fodder_carnivore

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for carnivore.

available_fodder_herbivore

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for herbivore.

number_of_carnivores

Finds the total number of carnivores in a specific cell.

number_of_herbivores

Finds the total number of herbivores in a specific cell.

sum_of_herbivore_mass

Calculates the total herbivore mass in the specific cell, i.e.

Methods

aging() The age of all animals in the specific cell is incremented by one, once a year.
cell_population([population]) Puts the animal population in the specific cell.
choose_migration_cell(animal, …) A method to choose which of the adjacent cell the animal should migrate to, given that it migrates, and moves the animal to that cell.
death() Updates the animal population list with the surviving animals after every year.
directional_probability(animal, neighbour_cells) This method estimates the propensity for each neighbouring cell, and calculates the probability of herbivores migrating to that cell.
eat_request_carnivore() Carnivore eats after request.
eat_request_herbivore() Herbivores eats after request and update of available fodder.
migrate(neighbour_cells) A method that migrates all animals in a cell iteratively.
propensity() Calculates the propensity of an animal migrating.
reproduction() Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.
set_landscape_parameters(new_parameters) This method allows for manual setting of landscape parameters, i.e.
sort_by_fitness() Updates and sorts animals in a specific cell by fitness, in descending order.
update_cell_population() Updates the animal population in the specific cell.
update_fitness() Updates the fitness for all animals in the cell.
weight_loss() Reduces weight of all animals once a year.

This method creates variables needed for the class.

Attributes:
available_fodder_carnivore

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for carnivore.

available_fodder_herbivore

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for herbivore.

number_of_carnivores

Finds the total number of carnivores in a specific cell.

number_of_herbivores

Finds the total number of herbivores in a specific cell.

sum_of_herbivore_mass

Calculates the total herbivore mass in the specific cell, i.e.

directional_probability(animal, neighbour_cells) This method estimates the propensity for each neighbouring cell, and calculates the probability of herbivores migrating to that cell.
eat_request_carnivore() Carnivore eats after request.
eat_request_herbivore() Herbivores eats after request and update of available fodder.
migrate(neighbour_cells) A method that migrates all animals in a cell iteratively.
propensity() Calculates the propensity of an animal migrating.
reproduction() Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.
set_landscape_parameters(new_parameters) This method allows for manual setting of landscape parameters, i.e.
sort_by_fitness() Updates and sorts animals in a specific cell by fitness, in descending order.
update_cell_population() Updates the animal population in the specific cell.
update_fitness() Updates the fitness for all animals in the cell.
weight_loss() Reduces weight of all animals once a year.
aging()¶

The age of all animals in the specific cell is incremented by one, once a year.

available_fodder_carnivore¶

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for carnivore.

Returns:float.
available_fodder_herbivore¶

Finding the relative abundance of fodder for herbivore.

Returns:float.
cell_population(population=None)¶

Puts the animal population in the specific cell.

Parameters:population – list.
choose_migration_cell(animal, neighbour_cells, probability_list)¶

A method to choose which of the adjacent cell the animal should migrate to, given that it migrates, and moves the animal to that cell.

Parameters:
  • animal – object, either herbivore or carnivore.
  • probability_list – list, probabilities of moving to an adjacent cell.
  • neighbour_cells – list, objects of adjacent cells.
death()¶

Updates the animal population list with the surviving animals after every year.

directional_probability(animal, neighbour_cells)¶

This method estimates the propensity for each neighbouring cell, and calculates the probability of herbivores migrating to that cell. Stores the result in a list.

Parameters:
  • animal – object, either herbivore or carnivore.
  • neighbour_cells – list, the four adjacent cells.
Return probability_list:
 

list, probabilities of moving to an adjacent cell.
eat_request_carnivore()¶

Carnivore eats after request.

eat_request_herbivore()¶

Herbivores eats after request and update of available fodder.

migrate(neighbour_cells)¶

A method that migrates all animals in a cell iteratively.

Parameters:neighbour_cells – list, objects of adjacent cells.
number_of_carnivores¶

Finds the total number of carnivores in a specific cell.

Returns:integer, number of carnivores.
number_of_herbivores¶

Finds the total number of herbivores in a specific cell.

Returns:integer, number of herbivores.
propensity()¶

Calculates the propensity of an animal migrating.

Returns:tuple, the propensities of herbivore and carnivore migration in first and second element of the tuple, respectively.
reproduction()¶

Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.

classmethod set_landscape_parameters(new_parameters)¶

This method allows for manual setting of landscape parameters, i.e. to change parameter values from default values to desired values.

Parameters:new_parameters – dict, dictionary with the new parameter values. Only keys from the default parameter value dict are valid.
sort_by_fitness()¶

Updates and sorts animals in a specific cell by fitness, in descending order.

sum_of_herbivore_mass¶

Calculates the total herbivore mass in the specific cell, i.e. the sum of the herbivore weights.

Returns:integer, the sum of herbivore mass in the cell.
update_cell_population()¶

Updates the animal population in the specific cell.

update_fitness()¶

Updates the fitness for all animals in the cell.

weight_loss()¶

Reduces weight of all animals once a year.

class biosim.landscape.Jungle[source]¶

Defines the jungle type.

Attributes:

Finds the total number of herbivores in a specific cell.

sum_of_herbivore_mass

Calculates the total herbivore mass in the specific cell, i.e.

Methods

aging() The age of all animals in the specific cell is incremented by one, once a year.
cell_population([population]) Puts the animal population in the specific cell.
choose_migration_cell(animal, …) A method to choose which of the adjacent cell the animal should migrate to, given that it migrates, and moves the animal to that cell.
death() Updates the animal population list with the surviving animals after every year.
directional_probability(animal, neighbour_cells) This method estimates the propensity for each neighbouring cell, and calculates the probability of herbivores migrating to that cell.
eat_request_carnivore() Carnivore eats after request.
eat_request_herbivore() Herbivores eats after request and update of available fodder.
migrate(neighbour_cells) A method that migrates all animals in a cell iteratively.
propensity() Calculates the propensity of an animal migrating.
regenerate() This method regenerates the amount of fodder in each jungle-cell according to the given formula for the jungle-type.
reproduction() Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.

regenerate()[source]¶

This method regenerates the amount of fodder in each jungle-cell according to the given formula for the jungle-type.

reproduction()¶

Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.

classmethod set_landscape_parameters(new_parameters)¶

This method allows for manual setting of landscape parameters, i.e. to change parameter values from default values to desired values.

Parameters:new_parameters – dict, dictionary with the new parameter values. Only keys from the default parameter value dict are valid.

choose_migration_cell(animal, neighbour_cells, probability_list)¶

A method to choose which of the adjacent cell the animal should migrate to, given that it migrates, and moves the animal to that cell.

  • probability_list – list, probabilities of moving to an adjacent cell.
  • neighbour_cells – list, objects of adjacent cells.
death()¶

Updates the animal population list with the surviving animals after every year.

directional_probability(animal, neighbour_cells)¶

This method estimates the propensity for each neighbouring cell, and calculates the probability of herbivores migrating to that cell. Stores the result in a list.

Parameters:
  • animal – object, either herbivore or carnivore.
  • neighbour_cells – list, the four adjacent cells.
Return probability_list:
 

list, probabilities of moving to an adjacent cell.
eat_request_carnivore()¶

Carnivore eats after request.

eat_request_herbivore()¶

Herbivores eats after request and update of available fodder.

migrate(neighbour_cells)¶

A method that migrates all animals in a cell iteratively.

Parameters:neighbour_cells – list, objects of adjacent cells.
number_of_carnivores¶

Finds the total number of carnivores in a specific cell.

Returns:integer, number of carnivores.
number_of_herbivores¶

Finds the total number of herbivores in a specific cell.

Returns:integer, number of herbivores.
propensity()¶

Calculates the propensity of an animal migrating.

Returns:tuple, the propensities of herbivore and carnivore migration in first and second element of the tuple, respectively.
reproduction()¶

Finds out which animals for each species that reproduce, based on reproduction probability, and adds a newborn of that species to the cell.

classmethod set_landscape_parameters(new_parameters)¶

This method allows for manual setting of landscape parameters, i.e. to change parameter values from default values to desired values.

Parameters:new_parameters – dict, dictionary with the new parameter values. Only keys from the default parameter value dict are valid.
sort_by_fitness()¶

Updates and sorts animals in a specific cell by fitness, in descending order.

sum_of_herbivore_mass¶

Calculates the total herbivore mass in the specific cell, i.e. the sum of the herbivore weights.

Returns:integer, the sum of herbivore mass in the cell.
update_cell_population()¶

Updates the animal population in the specific cell.

update_fitness()¶

Updates the fitness for all animals in the cell.

weight_loss()¶

Reduces weight of all animals once a year.

Module animals¶

biosim.animals defines the similar traits between our two animals in the ecosystem. The two subclasses, Herbivore and Carnivore, specifies the more specific traits that are intrinsic for each animal. The module returns either herbivore or carnivore objects, depending on what the simulation is calling for.

The user can define:
  • The user can define the species of the animal.
  • The weight and age can be specified.
class biosim.animals.Animal(weight=None, age=0)[source]¶

This class creates an idea Animal, not specifying the -vore-type.

Attributes:
fitness

Calculates the fitness of the animal.

Methods

aging() Animal ages by one year.
animal_weight_loss() Updates animal weight after annual weight loss.
death() Estimates the probability of an animal dying.
migration_probability() Probability for the animal to migrate.
reproduction_probability(n_animals) Estimates the probability of reproduction for the given animal.
set_animal_parameters(new_parameters) This method allows for manual setting of animal parameters, i.e.
update_weight_after_birth() If reproduction is successful, then a new animal is born, and the mother”s weight is reduced by the given formula.

This method creates variables needed for the class.

Parameters:
  • weight – float, weight of the animal.
  • age – int, age of the animal.
Attributes:

Calculates the fitness of the animal.

Methods

animal_weight_loss() Updates animal weight after annual weight loss.
death() Estimates the probability of an animal dying.

update_weight_after_birth() If reproduction is successful, then a new animal is born, and the mother”s weight is reduced by the given formula.

Calculates the fitness of the animal.

Probability for the animal to migrate.

Returns:bool.

Estimates the probability of reproduction for the given animal.

Parameters:n_animals – integer, number of animals that may reproduce.
Return reproduction_success:
 bool, the animal reproduces or not.
classmethod set_animal_parameters(new_parameters)[source]¶

This method allows for manual setting of animal parameters, i.e. to change parameter values from default values to desired values.

Parameters:new_parameters – dict, dictionary with the new parameter values. Only keys from the default parameter value dict are valid.
update_weight_after_birth()[source]¶

If reproduction is successful, then a new animal is born, and the mother”s weight is reduced by the given formula.

\[w = \xi * N(w_{birth}, \sigma_{birth})\]
class biosim.animals.Carnivore(weight=None, age=0)[source]¶

A subclass of the superclass Animal, which creates a carnivore with its default parameters.

Attributes:
fitness

Calculates the fitness of the animal.

Methods

aging() Animal ages by one year.

migration_probability() Probability for the animal to migrate.
move(cell) This method appends the carnivore to a list of the new population of the cell.

set_animal_parameters(new_parameters) This method allows for manual setting of animal parameters, i.e.
update_weight_after_birth() If reproduction is successful, then a new animal is born, and the mother”s weight is reduced by the given formula.
